Hello, 
 
I am using 
 
WebSphere Studio Application Developer (Windows) Version: 5.1.0  Build id: 
20030726_2016
 
Running IBM WebSphere Commerce Server 55 Fix Pack 3
 
On windows 2000 Pro Version 5.0.2195 SP3 Build2195
 
It seems whenever I hit a break point my processor is pegged a 100% and the 
editor is unresponsive.  Sometimes it comes out of this other times I have to 
kill the editor and restart.
 
Below are some exceptions that may apply.  
 
Any help in this matter is greatly appreciated.
 
Thank You,
  Jon

The first exception (disconnection) is handled (logged), and does not 
represent a problem - it looks like a toString() is being computed after a 
target has disconnected/terminated.

The second log looks like a problem with the SQLJ debugger (not Eclipse). 
Perhaps an attempt is being made to add an object to an empty list constant 
(i.e. a list that does not support additions).

Do you know which  version of the Eclipse plugins are being used in this 
build? (2.0/2.1?) WSAD product versions are not the same as Eclipse versions.

My Eclipse Plugins are at Version 2.1

org.eclipse.debug.core  = 2.1.0
org.eclipse.debug.ui = 2.1.1
org.eclipse.jdt.debug = 2.1.0
org.eclipse.jdt.ui = 2.1.1  Rest of jdt are at 2.1.1
org.eclipse.emf = 1.1.0

If there are any other specific packages you need please let me know.

Please file a bug against the appropriate product for the SQLJ problem 
(UnsupportedOperationException).

Can you provide us with a thread dump when your processor is pegged at 100%? 
(I.e. start eclispe with a DOS console, and then use CTRL-Break to get a 
thread dump when the processor is pegged).

Thank you for your reply Darin and your continued effort.

I have a question, I know that if I start a Java main from a console I can then 
do the Control Break and get a thread dump, the problem is that IBM WSAD starts 
from an exe so this will not work, is there a work around?

Use the "-vm" argument to specify the VM/executable to use, something like:

-vm c:\jdk1.4.2\jre\bin\java.exe

Also see

http://help.eclipse.org/help21/index.jsp?
topic=/org.eclipse.platform.doc.user/tasks/running_eclipse.htm

OK, here is a thread dump.

Thanks,
  John.
